IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TREATING THE WHOLE PERSON - MIND, BODY AND SPIRIT - IN ELKHART AND ST. JOSEPH COUNTIES, INDIANA.
IRS990.MissionDesc: WITH UNCOMMON EXPERTISE IN MENTAL HEALTH AND ADDICTIONS SERVICES, OAKLAWN JOINS WITH INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES, AND OUR COMMUNITY ON THE JOURNEY TOWARD HEALTH AND WHOLENESS.
IRS990.Desc: OUTPATIENT SERVICES - PROVIDED OVER 145,180 CLIENT SERVICE ENCOUNTERS OF GROUP THERAPY, MEDICATION MANAGEMENT, AND INDIVIDUAL THERAPY; PROVIDED 75,289 CLIENT SERVICE ENCOUNTERS OF CARE COORDINATION; PROVIDED 79,583 CLIENT SERVICE ENCOUNTERS OF SKILLS BUILDING IN PERSONAL CARE AND COMMUNITY LIVING; AND PROVIDED AN ADDITIONAL 42,151 ENCOUNTERS OF OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICES. IN SUMMARY, A TOTAL OF 16,194 CONSUMERS WERE SERVED IN THE FISCAL YEAR.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: RESIDENTIAL SERVICES - IN ADDITION TO THE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES FOR THIS POPULATION, THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDED 30,630 DAYS OF CHILD & ADOLESCENT RESIDENTIAL CARE AND 6,085 DAYS OF THERAPEUTIC FOSTER CARE. ADDITIONALLY, ADULTS LIVING IN SUPERVISED GROUP LIVING ARRANGEMENTS ARE PROVIDED RESIDENTIAL SUPPORT SERVICES ALONG WITH THE NECESSARY PSYCHIATRIC AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE SERVICES. A TOTAL OF 40,565 DAYS WERE PROVIDED TO THIS SEGMENT OF THE ADULT POPULATION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: INPATIENT SERVICES - PROVIDED 4,738 INPATIENT DAYS OF PSYCHIATRIC AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE STABILIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A PORTION OF MEMBERSHIP DUES PAID TO INDIANA COUNCIL OF COMMUNITY MENTAL HEALTH CENTERS (ICCMHC) AND INDIANA ASSOCIATION OF RESIDENTIAL CHILD CARE AGENCIES (IARCCA) WERE ATTRIBUTED TO LOBBYING EXPENSES.

FOOTNOTE TO THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS THAT REPORTS THE ORGANIZATION'S LIABILITY FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS UNDER FIN 48 SUPERSEDED BY FASB CODIFICATION ASC 740: ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES GENERALLY ACCEPTED IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA REQUIRE MANAGEMENT TO EVALUATE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY OPC AND AFFILIATES AND RECOGNIZE A TAX LIABILITY IF OPC AND AFFILIATES HAS TAKEN AN UNCERTAIN POSITION THAT MORE LIKELY THAN NOT WOULD NOT BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY VARIOUS FEDERAL AND STATE TAXING AUTHORITIES. MANAGEMENT HAS ANALYZED THE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY OPC AND AFFILIATES, AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT AS OF JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION OF A LIABILITY OR DISCLOSURE IN THE ACCOMPANYING CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. OPC AND AFFILIATES ARE SUBJECT TO ROUTINE AUDITS BY TAXING JURISDICTIONS; HOWEVER, THERE ARE CURRENTLY NO AUDITS FOR ANY TAX PERIODS IN PROGRESS.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES FOR VARIOUS NEEDS THROUGH RESIDENT

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: HOSPITAL AUTHORITY OF ELKHART COUNTY INDIANA

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART I, BOND ISSUE, ROW A, COLUMN F
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DESCRIPTION OF PURPOSE: THE ISSUE WAS TO REFINANCE PREVIOUSLY ISSUED "ADJUSTABLE RATE DEMAND REVENUE REFUNDING AND IMPROVEMENT BONDS, SERIES 2006".

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE L, PART IV, BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS INVOLVING INTERESTED PERSONS:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: (A) NAME OF INTERESTED PERSON: EVERENCE(B) RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN INTERESTED PERSON AND ORGANIZATION: THE PRESIDENT OF EVERENCE, KEN HOCHSTETLER, SERVED AS A BOARD MEMBER FOR OAKLAWN PSYCHIATRIC CENTER, INC. (C) AMOUNT OF TRANSACTION: $5,860,270(D) DESCRIPTION OF TRANSACTION: EVERENCE ADMINISTERS THE EMPLOYEE HEALTH INSURANCE PLAN FOR OAKLAWN PSYCHIATRIC CENTER, INC. AND IS THE INVESTMENT ADVISOR FOR ITS 403B RETIREMENT PLAN. TRANSACTION AMOUNT IS FOR INSURANCE PREMIUMS PAID.

IN ADDITION TO ALL VOLUNTEER BOARD OF DIRECTORS, THE ORGANIZATION IS SUPPORTED BY MORE THAN 52 ACTIVE VOLUNTEERS WHO SERVE IN A VARIETY OF SUPPORT SERVICES. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR OVER 3,200 HOURS OF SERVICE WERE GIVEN BY THESE VOLUNTEERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DELEGATED AUTHORITY: PER THE BYLAWS, THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD IS AUTHORIZED TO ACT ON THE FULL BOARD'S BEHALF. THE FULL BOARD MEETS QUARTERLY AND THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE GENERALLY MEETS AN ADDITIONAL FOUR TIMES ON ALTERNATE MONTHS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ELECTION OF MEMBERS: VOTING MEMBERS ARE SELECTED BY THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION, MENNONITE HEALTH SERVICES ALLIANCE, AS PROVIDED IN THE BY-LAWS AND ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION OF OAKLAWN PSYCHIATRIC CENTER, INC. BOARD MEMBERS APPOINTED BY MENNONITE HEALTH SERVICES ALLIANCE ARE THE SOLE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 REVIEW PROCESS: THE PROCESS OF REVIEWING THE FORM 990 INCLUDES A DETAILED REVIEW BY THE ORGANIZATION'S SENIOR MANAGEMENT AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER. THE GOVERNING BODY RECEIVES A COPY OF THE FORM 990 INCLUDING REQUESTED SCHEDULES, AS ULTIMATELY FILED WITH THE IRS, FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CONFLICT OF INTEREST COMPLIANCE: THE ORGANIZATION REGULARLY AND CONSISTENTLY MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. OAKLAWN STAFF, BOARD MEMBERS, VOLUNTEERS AND AGENTS SHALL EXERCISE THE UTMOST GOOD FAITH IN ALL TRANSACTIONS TOUCHING UPON THEIR DUTY TO OAKLAWN AND ITS PROPERTY, AND SHALL FULLY DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST. ANNUALLY, BOARD MEMBERS SIGN THAT THEY WILL ABIDE BY THE POLICY AND DECLARE ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST THEY MAY HAVE WITH THE ORGANIZATION OR ITS RELATED ORGANIZATIONS, AND ABSTAIN FROM ANY VOTING WHERE A CONFLICT COULD EXIST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROCESS OF DETERMINING COMPENSATION: TOP OFFICIAL: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE COMPENSATION PACKAGE PROVIDED TO THE PRESIDENT & CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER OF THE ORGANIZATION. THE COMPENSATION REVIEW INCLUDES A MARKET ANALYSIS STUDY AND A PERFORMANCE REVIEW. THIS PROCESS IS DOCUMENTED IN THE BOARD MINUTES. OTHER OFFICERS: THE ORGANIZATION ANNUALLY PARTICIPATES IN SEVERAL MARKET SURVEYS. MANAGEMENT COMPARES COMPENSATION LEVELS OF LIKE POSITIONS AND STRIVES TO ADJUST THE ORGANIZATION'S COMPENSATION PACKAGES FOR LIKE POSITIONS TO FALL WITHIN THE RANGE OF THE MARKET WITH A GOAL TO BE COMPETITIVELY PLACED BETWEEN THE 50TH AND 75TH PERCENTILE OF THE MARKET RANGE. THIS PROCESS IS DOCUMENTED IN THE BOARD MINUTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC: COPIES OF THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE PROVIDED FOR REVIEW UPON REQUEST. IN ADDITION, THE ORGANIZATION IS ACCREDITED BY THE JOINT COMMISSION; MEETING THE REQUIREMENTS FOR THE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CARE ACCREDITATION PROCESS. ALSO, THE ORGANIZATION IS CERTIFIED BY THE STATE OF INDIANA FAMILY AND SOCIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION, DIVISION OF MENTAL HEALTH AND ADDICTIONS, AS AN INDIANA COMMUNITY MENTAL HEALTH CENTER (CMHC). ACCORDINGLY, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE REVIEWED AND REGULARLY PROVIDED TO THESE AND OTHER PUBLIC BODIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART XII, LINE 2C, OVERSIGHT OF AUDIT:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND NO PROCESSES HAVE CHANGED FROM PRIOR YEAR.
